intro: Cryptangium campestre, commonly known as the field cryptangium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered white or greenish flowers. Its leaves are finely divided and often emit a mild, spicy scent. Cryptangium campestre is typically found in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
